name: ImageSetStatistics
author: ANTs developers
description:
Advanced Normalization Tools (ANTs) is a C++ library available through the command line that computes high-dimensional mappings to capture the statistics of brain structure and function. It allows one to organize, visualize and statistically explore large biomedical image sets. Additionally, it integrates imaging modalities in space + time and works across species or organ systems with minimal customization.

The ANTs library is considered a state-of-the-art medical image registration and segmentation toolkit which depends on the Insight ToolKit, a widely used medical image processing library to which ANTs developers contribute. ANTs-related tools have also won several international, unbiased competitions such as MICCAI, BRATS, and STACOM.

inputs.name: Image Dimension
inputs.description: The dimensionality of the images to be processed by ImageSetStatistics.

inputs.name: Controls List
inputs.description: Text file containing the list of control images.

inputs.name: Output Image
inputs.description: The output image file where the computed statistics are stored.

inputs.name: Which Stat
inputs.description: Choice of statistic to compute: 0 for median, 1 for max probability appearance, 2 for weighted mean appearance, 3 for trimmed mean, 4 for max value, 5 for similarity-weighted (requires imagelist2), 6 for best local match label, 7 for max value from ROI.

inputs.name: ROI Image
inputs.description: Region of interest image file, optional depending on the whichstat option.

inputs.name: Image List 2
inputs.description: List of similarity images used for similarity-weighted statistics. Required if whichstat equals 5 or 6.

output-files.name: Computed Statistics Image
output-files.description: The output image containing the computed statistics.
